name: XO-2 S
scenarioDescription:
The XO-2 S Exoplanetary System


Overview

XO-2 S is a star with 0.98 times the mass of the Sun, and 1 times its radius. It is located 495.95 light years away from the solar system.

XO-2 S is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the XO-2 S system


XO-2 S b

XO-2 S b was discovered by the Roque de los Muchachos Observatory observatory using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.13 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of XO-2 S b is 82.68 times the mass of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, XO-2 S b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.


XO-2 S c

XO-2 S c was discovered by the Roque de los Muchachos Observatory observatory using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.48 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of XO-2 S c is 435.66 times the mass of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, XO-2 S c is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system XO-2 S, which contains 2 planets and was discovered by Roque de los Muchachos Observatory.
